title: Shimmer
summaries: Shimmer is a shiny, lavender-colored, pearlescent liquid. It can be found at any point in the game in the Aether, a mini-biome that generates once per world in the Underground or Cavern layers, and always on the same half of the world as the Jungle. After the Moon Lord has been defeated, it can be obtained limitlessly by using the Bottomless Shimmer Bucket.
Shimmer has the unique function of transforming ("transmuting") certain dropped items and entities submerged in it:

• Most crafted items are transformed back ("decrafted") into their crafting materials.
  • Certain items are transformed into other items. A few items can only be obtained via this transformation, such as Ambrosia. Some item transformations only work under certain conditions.
  • The sprite of town NPCs is changed.
  • Certain enemies are transformed into other enemies.
  • Most critters are transformed into Faelings.

Items will float upwards after transformation until they leave the liquid, then linger in midair and produce vibrant lights until a player picks them up, similarly to <linked>souls</linked>. Items that cannot be transformed will sink to the bottom of the Shimmer.
In addition to its transforming effect, Shimmer also has an effect on other entities that enter it:

• When a player is submerged in the liquid, they will be inflicted with the Shimmering debuff, beginning to fall slowly and phasing through all blocks until they reach an opening.
  • Certain projectiles will bounce upwards upon contact with a Shimmer pool, such as a falling Fallen Star.
  • When enemies that have no special transmutations and are not immune to the Shimmering debuff (e.g. the Werewolf) enter Shimmer, they will slowly become more transparent, and eventually turn completely invisible. Then they will slowly become more and more opaque. Attacking the enemy will make it turn opaque faster.

Unlike other liquids, the player cannot <linked>fish</linked> or use items in Shimmer, nor can it be picked up with an <linked>Empty Bucket</linked>. Shimmer also does not have a <linked>liquid bomb</linked> variant. It can still be moved by <linked>pumps</linked>, however.
Upon contact with any other liquid, Shimmer will form <linked>Aetherium Blocks</linked>.
Item transmutations
Below is a list of special item transmutations. The common decrafting transmutations are not included.

Decrafting exceptions

Items which have multiple recipes are only decrafted into one specific set of ingredients. For instance, the Frost armor can be crafted with Adamantite or Titanium Bars, but it will always decraft into Adamantite Bars, even in worlds that have Titanium. A few items are decrafted into a unique set of items, such as the Copper Pickaxe, which is decrafted into Wood and Copper Ore, even though Copper Ore is not part of its crafting recipe. Items crafted at a Placed Bottle or Alchemy Table are decrafted into a random subset of their ingredients. Items crafted with Bones cannot be decrafted until Skeletron is defeated and items crafted with Lihzahrd Bricks cannot be decrafted until Golem is defeated. Lastly, certain items cannot be decrafted at all in order to prevent exploits or certain unfortunate implications. For example, decrafting the Blizzard in a Bottle, which can be found in Chests in the Ice biome, would allow obtaining a Frost Core in pre-Hardmode, and decrafting a Bunny Stew would mean bringing a dead, cooked Bunny back to life.
Below are lists of these decrafting exceptions. Crafted items that already have a special item transmutation are not included.

NPC transmutations

When submerged in Shimmer, any NPCs (except town pets) will transform into their Shimmered form. This has no impact on gameplay or dialogue and is only a visual change. They can be returned to their classic looks by being submerged in Shimmer again.
